Dialogue:
DT: Nice to meet you.
CO: Nice to meet you, too.
DT: Did you go out somewhere today?
CO: No, I stayed home all day.
DT: When it's hot, it's understandable not wanting to go out.
CO: I opened the balcony, and it was too hot, so I stayed inside.
DT: Do you not prefer summer?
CO: I like summer. I enjoy activities like going to the sea.
DT: Did you go to the beach this year?
CO: I haven't gone. I don't plan to go this year until the coronavirus situation improves.
DT: When do you think it will end?
CO: The peak has passed, so it might end after autumn.
DT: Hmm, I'm not sure. It seems challenging.
CO: Is it difficult?
DT: We can't travel, can we?
CO: Do you like traveling?
DT: Yes, I do. But I prefer traveling overseas, so I can't go at all right now.
CO: Where was your last overseas trip?
DT: Sweden.
CO: Northern Europe? It must have been cold.
DT: I went in September; it was already cold.
CO: What is that place famous for?
DT: It's known as the setting for Kiki's Delivery Service.
CO: IKEA is from Sweden, right?
DT: That's right! But there wasn't an IKEA in the city I visited.
CO: Is that so? You can visit IKEA in Japan, right?
DT: Yes, IKEA in Japan is enough.
CO: Do you often travel to Europe?
DT: Yes, I often used low-cost carriers to fly around.
CO: That sounds great. I'd like to go there someday.

DT: Good evening.
CO: Good evening! How can I assist you today?
DT: Have you bought anything recently? Other than food.
CO: Recently, I have acquired items such as clothes and bags. How about you?
DT: Do you often buy clothes?
CO: Not frequently. I typically wear secondhand clothes, but I purchased something for work this time.
DT: I see. Are you doing more remote work or working in the office?
CO: I have been going to the office more frequently now. Things have settled down a bit.
DT: Do you wear a suit when you go to the office?
CO: It's now office casual. Wearing a shirt and pants is acceptable.
DT: That sounds comfortable and convenient.
CO: Yes, with a lot of fieldwork now, sneakers are really comfortable.
DT: That’s good. Working outside during the summer must be tough.
CO: It can be quite challenging. Staying hydrated is essential to avoid heatstroke. Are you currently working?
DT: I am currently focused on childcare.
CO: Understood. Have you made any recent purchases?
DT: Recently, I bought clothes for the baby. It’s enjoyable just to look at them as they are very cute.
CO: Does that include stores like Nishimatsuya?
DT: Yes, stores like Akachan Honpo and similar ones.
CO: Sometimes I shop for my friend's child as well.
DT: Are you getting a gift?
CO: Yes, for when the child was born. However, I am unsure of what to buy.
DT: Any gift would likely be appreciated. A small toy might be a good idea.
CO: I wonder if there are any specific preferences. Is any toy suitable?
DT: Some toys might be preferred based on characters, so something generic like a rattle with animals might be better.
CO: That is helpful advice.
DT: I was happy to receive a toy made of rice from my cousin.
CO: Rice? Is that commonly available?
DT: Yes, it is sold. It’s made from rice, which makes it safe for the baby to put in their mouth.
CO: That is interesting. I will consider that option.
